headline: HPE Met With Top DOJ Leaders to Save $14 Billion Juniper Deal
summary: (Bloomberg) -- Hewlett Packard Enterprise Co. and Juniper Networks Inc. representatives met with Justice Department antitrust enforcers last week in a final effort to persuade the agency not to challenge their proposed $14 billion deal, according to people familiar with the matter.Most Read from BloombergParis to Replace Parking Spaces With TreesNew York’s Transit Agency Approves $9 Congestion TollIn Cleveland, a Forgotten Streetcar Bridge Gets a Long-Awaited LiftAmtrak Wins $300 Million to Fix

headline: Heard on the Street: Nvidia Overheating Report Unlikely to Cool AI Server Demand
summary: Nvidia’s newest artificial intelligence systems may or may not have an overheating issue.  Nvidia’s stock slipped more than 3% after the opening bell following a report over the weekend by The Information that the company is still tweaking the design of one of its newest systems to prevent overheating.  In the meantime, Dell, Super Micro and Hewlett Packard Enterprise--all of whom make servers using Nvidia’s chips--all made strong gains in morning trades.

headline: HP Enterprise Stock Is a Buy for an AI Server Boom, Analyst Says
summary: Raymond James analyst Simon Leopold upgraded Hewlett Packard Enterprise stock to Strong Buy from Outperform, and increased his price forecast to $29 from $23.

headline: Raymond James upgrades HPE stock to Strong Buy, shares climb
summary: Investing.com -- Shares in HP (NYSE:HPQ) Enterprise climbed more than 2% Monday after Raymond (NS:RYMD) James upgraded the stock to Strong Buy from Outperform.
